chargeHist.descr: Use a Computer to Facilitate a Child Sex Crime

result.execSummary:
The defendant Brady T Schoonover was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Brady T Schoonover is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Brady T Schoonover was found guilty of 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
**Restitution Hearing is requested**
**RESTITUTION WAS SET AT $0.00
***
***RESTITUTION HAS NOW BEEN SET AT A TOTAL OF $2688 ***

If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.`
***BOND IS NOW APPLIED  -  BALANCE STILL DUE TO BE COLLECTED

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  
*  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.   
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  
*  Pay restitution plus surcharges.  Restitution hearing has been requested.    
Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.  May not have contact with victim.  No contact with anyone under the age of 18 yrs of age.

10:31 AM  Attorney James Kraus appeared for the State. Attorney Hilary D. Edwards in court for Defendant Brady T Schoonover.  Clerk: H.Naydihor.  Atty Edwards objects to the hearing for reasons stated on the record.  State witnesses sworn and testified Clayton Ohlrich, Michelle Erwin; no cross by Atty Edwards.  Exhibits 1-2 offered and received.   Arguments heard.  Court finds restitution in the amount of $2688 to be split, $1344 to Clayton Ohlrich and $1344 Michelle Erwin.  Court finds the DOC shall determine the earning capacity of DE to determine his ability to pay.  State to prepare the Order.

Extended Supervision Conditions-Ordered by the Court-
6yrs WSP followed by 6yrs of ES.  Deft not eligible for CIP or SAP

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA James Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Hilary Edwards.  Victim rights compliance; victim statement made.  Sentencing arguments made.  Deft sentenced to 6yrs WSP followed by 6yrs of ES.  See ES conditions.  Credit for 2 days.  Deft not eligible for CIP or SAP.  Appeal rights.  Firearm warning.  Voting acknowledgment.  DNA ordered; written notice given to deft.  Restitution is requested; TBD.  Restitution hrg necessary

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA James Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody (Walworth pending case) w/Atty Hilary Edwards.  Case is resolved.  Victim rights compliance.  Deft pleads guilty to count 2; found guilty by the Court.  Remaining counts are dismissed on State's motion.  PSI ordered.  Sentencing set for 2/2/18 @ 10am
